titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States permitting the President to grant a pardon to an individual only after such individual has been convicted.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution.

bill.summary: 1/4/1995--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Empowers the President to grant a reprieve or a pardon for an offense only to an individual who has been convicted of such offense.
